title: Precession-Assisted 4D-STEM Strain Characterization of Semiconductor Devices
content: The demand for characterization tools for material properties at the nanoscale is always increasing. Material functional properties can be tuned according to nanometric characteristics of the material. Carrier mobility enhancement achieved via processed-induced strain in the semiconductor industry is the most relevant example of such property tuning [1]. Strain characterization of nanomaterials is generally performed using transmission electron microscopy (TEM). Geometric phase analysis, (dark-field) electron holography (DFEH), and 4D-STEM are some of the different methods for strain characterization in a TEM, each with advantages and drawbacks [2].
